intro: Thesium debile, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Its flowering stems bear small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Thesium debile is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
